zone.line: With blood, & hearts broken by long hope, & love
Dragged to
Slain at his altars soiled & garlandless
Flattering the thing they feared, which fear was hate
Stand mouldering fast, oer their abandoned shrines —
Frown,
The painted veil by those who were, called life,
Which mimicked, as with colours idly spread,
All men believed or hoped, is torn aside—
The loathsome mask has fallen, the man remains
Sceptreless, free, uncircumscribed :— but man :
Equal, unclassed, tribeless, & nationless
Exempt from awe , worship, degree,— the King
Over himself; just, gentle, wise :—but man:
1866 yet
5Passionless ? no — but free from guilt [or] pain
29Which were, for his will made, or suffered them ,
1900 Nor yet though
[15] Though not exempt, yet ruling them like slaves,
From chance & death & mutability

line.del: Which clog that spirit, else which might

zone.line: The loftiest star of unascended Heaven
Pinnacled dim in the intense inane.
Prometheus
